alert.note: Alert for Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:44PM CDT until April 13 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR EASTERN NEWTON...SOUTHERN KEMPER AND LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 844 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Martin to near Rose Hill, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Liberty, Prismatic and Damascus around 850 PM CDT. Blackwater and Daleville around 855 PM CDT. Meridian Station and Savoy around 900 PM CDT. Lauderdale, Tamola, Zero and Porterville around 905 PM CDT. Increase around 910 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Chunky and Hickory. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
